Kris Jenner (born Kristen Mary Houghton on April 5, 1955) is an American entrepreneur, television personality, and a businesswoman widely known for her role as a central figure in the reality television show "Keeping Up with the Kardashians." Over the years, Jenner has become a household name and has gained a large following on social media.

Kris Jenner was born in Lakewood, California, and grew up in a working-class family. She met her future husband, Caitlyn Marie Jenner, in 1977, when both were high school students in the same gymnastics class. They got married in 1981 and had four children together: Kourtney, Khloé, Rob, and Kim.

Jenner's entrepreneurial spirit kicked in early on, as she started several businesses with her family members, including the family's clothing line, D-A-S-H, and their joint venture in the hospitality industry, The Kardashian Koofta, a bed and breakfast in Los Angeles.

In 2007, Jenner signed a deal with E! Entertainment to produce and host her reality television show, "Kourtney and Kim Take Miami," which helped launch her and her children's career as a reality TV staple. The show's success led to the creation of "Keeping Up with the Kardashians" in 2007, which further solidified her and her family's presence in the media world.

Throughout the years, Kris Jenner has also been an active philanthropist, supporting numerous charities and foundations such as the Surfrider Foundation, St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, and the American Diabetes Association.
